check_data(json_name, hdf5_name)¶

Checks for the existance of either file under the DATA_PATH, returns False if either is missing

Parameters:
  • hdf5_name (string) – name of the hdf5 file
  • json_name (string) – name of the json file
Returns:

False if either is missing, True otherwise
Return type:

bool
create_heatmap(x, y, z, df, title, layout=None, text=None)¶

Creates a heatmap x, y, and z

Parameters:
  • x (string) – name of the x value column
  • y (string) – name of the y value column
  • z (string) – name of the z value column
  • df (pandas dataframe) – dataframe
  • title (string) – heatmap title
  • layout (dictionary) – dictionary for plotly layout. Autogenerated if None is passed
  • text (string) – column to be displayed for hover text
Returns:

one dictionary to be used with plotly.utils.PlotlyJSONEncoder

list

generate_card_stats(game_mode='ranked', game_threshold=2)¶

Returns a groupby object with [‘card’, ‘p_deck_type’, ‘o_deck_type’, ‘turn’, ‘loss’, ‘win’] as [str, str, str, int, int, int] :param game_mode: game type :param card_threshold: the minimum amount of time the card has to show up :type game_mode: str :type card_threshold: str

Returns:cards
Return type:pandas groupby object
generate_cards(filtered)¶

Generates a grouped win/loss count for specific cards

Parameters:filtered (pandas dataframe) – subset of self.games filtered
Returns:p_df, o_df – cards marked as ‘me’ for player, index is the card name [‘card’], columns are win count and loss count [‘win’, ‘loss’], cards marked as ‘opponent’ for player, index is the card name [‘card’], columns are win count and loss count [‘win’, ‘loss’]
Return type:pandas groupby, pandas groupby
generate_collectobot_data()¶

Generates collect-o-bot data from the database, writes it to a hdf5 file

Returns:list of games
Return type:pandas dataframe
generate_decklist_matchups(game_mode='ranked', game_threshold=2)¶

Generates a dataframe with a list of cards, and the matchups where the card won and lost in the format of: [‘card’, ‘p_deck_type’, ‘winning_matchups’, ‘losing_matchups’]

Parameters:
  • game_mode (string) – the game mode, ‘ranked’, ‘casual’, or ‘both
  • game_threshold (int) – the minimum amount of games the deck has to show up
Returns:

cards with [‘card’, ‘p_deck_type’, ‘o_deck_type’, ‘loss’, ‘win’, ‘win%’]
Return type:

pandas groupby
generate_decks(dates=True)¶

Differentiates between the different deck types, and sorts them into their individual lists (history is a massive array, transform into a pandas dataframe for processing)

Parameters:dates (bool) – generate specific dates into their own columns
Returns:list of games
Return type:pandas dataframe
generate_matchups(game_mode='ranked', game_threshold=0)¶

Generates a pandas groupby table with duration, count, coin, win #, win%, and card_history

Parameters:
  • game_mode (string) – the game mode, ‘ranked’, ‘casual’, or ‘both
  • game_threshold (int) – the minimum amount of games the deck has to show up
Returns:

grouped, indicies are player ‘p_deck_type’ then opponent ‘o_deck_type’
Return type:

pandas groupby

pull_data(username, api_key)¶

Grabs the data from the trackobot servers, writes it out to a new files and the database if it doesn’t exist/outdated

Parameters:
  • username (string) – trackobot username
  • api_key (string) – trackobot api key
Returns:

contents of the json_files
Return type:

dictionary

  • json_name (string) – name of the json file

rebuild_and_update()¶

Pull collectobot data and remake the graphs

remake_graphs()¶

Remake the graphs

store_data()¶

Stores the python data by using the filename as the sha5 hash of the username and api_key -> hash is stored in a database for lookups later, data is stored using the hdf5 format Table is in the format of [‘user_hash’, ‘total_items’, ‘json_name’, ‘hdf5_name’]

Returns:total items, json_name, and hdf5_name
Return type:[int, string, string]
title_format(*titles)¶

Formats the titles

Parameters:titles (list of strings) – titles to be replaced
Returns:list of replaced titles
Return type:list of strings
update_count(user_hash, total_items)¶

Updates the given total items count for the user with user_hash
